questionText: Which protocol is used to assign IP addresses automatically?
Which device operates at the Data Link Layer?
What does TCP stand for?
explanation: TCP stands for Transmission Control Protocol.

questionText: Which protocol is used for secure web browsing?
Which layer is responsible for end-to-end communication?
What is the default port number of HTTP?
explanation: HTTP runs on port 80 by default.

questionText: What does IP stand for?
Which protocol is connection-oriented?
explanation: TCP establishes a connection before data transfer.

questionText: Which device connects different networks together?
Which layer deals with MAC addresses?
explanation: MAC addresses operate at Data Link Layer.

questionText: Which protocol is used to send emails?
explanation: SMTP is used for sending emails.

questionText: What is the port number for HTTPS?
Which topology has a central node?
explanation: Star topology has a central hub/switch.

questionText: Which protocol resolves domain names to IP addresses?
explanation: DNS converts domain names into IP addresses.

questionText: Which protocol is used for file transfer?
Which addressing is logical addressing?
Which protocol is used to check network connectivity?
explanation: ICMP is used for ping and diagnostics.

questionText: Which layer handles encryption and compression?
explanation: Presentation layer manages encryption and compression.

questionText: Which protocol is used to retrieve emails?
Which topology connects every device to every other device?
explanation: Mesh topology connects all devices directly.

questionText: Which protocol dynamically assigns IP addresses?
What is the size of IPv4 address?
Which device operates only at the Physical Layer?
explanation: Hub works at Physical Layer only.
